articles.title: The Fall of Afghanistan Echoes in Myanmar
articles.excerpt: The opposing sides of Myanmar's political crisis are projecting their own fantasies onto the fall of Kabul.
articles.summary:
Anti-coup protesters shout slogans as they march, during a protest at Pabedan township against the military coup in Yangon, Myanmar, Saturday, June 26, 2021.
Credit: AP PhotoAdvertisementThe spectacular fall of the U.S.-supported Afghan state to the Taliban has sent shockwaves across the globe. articles.author: Newsweek Pakistan
articles.excerpt: Meeting between Chief of Army Staff, U.S. Charge d'Affaires discusses matters of mutual interest, with emphasis on evolving situation in Kabul
articles.summary: File photo. Courtesy ISPRPakistan Army chief Gen. Qamar Javed Bajwa on Friday reiterated that Pakistan has no favorites in Afghanistan and merely wants to facilitate regional peace and stability.'Pakistan has no favorites in Afghanistan and our sole aim is helping achieve a peaceful, sovereign, stable, and prosperous Afghanistan,' he told U.S. Charge d'Affaires to Pakistan Angela Ageler during a meeting at General Headquarters in Rawalpindi, according to a statement issued by the Inter-Services

articles.summary:
(MENAFN - IANS)

San Francisco, Aug 28 (IANS) Apple has announced a new service programme for iPhone 12 and iPhone 12 Pro models that suffer from sound issues when placing or receiving calls.

According to AppleInsider, the "iPhone 12 and iPhone 12 Pro Service Programme for No Sound Issues" covers a limited number of devices manufactured between October 2020 and April 2021.

The company noted other iPhone models, including iPhone 12 mini and iPhone 12 Pro Max, are not part of the programme.

articles.title: Family's help with child care comes at a cost
articles.excerpt: DEAR ABBY: I am a mother of four (soon to be five) young children. It is exhausting. My husband helps as much as he can, but sometimes we both need
articles.summary: DEAR ABBY: I am a mother of four (soon to be five) young children. It is exhausting. My husband helps as much as he can, but sometimes we both need a break. My parents offer to watch the kids. The problem is, my parents and I have opposite political and world views. Sometimes they'll say things to my children like, 'You're such a ditzy girl, you better find a good husband!' Or call a former president 'the devil.' My husband and I have VERY different opinions than they do, and we worry about thei

articles.title: Three Soldiers Killed in Attack on Mountain Fort
articles.author: AFP
articles.excerpt: Another two injured in assault, claimed by Ansar-ul-Mujahideen, on FC Qila in North Waziristan.
articles.summary: File Photo. Asif Hassan—AFPThree paramilitary soldiers were killed when a group of militants launched a rocket attack on a mountain fort in North Waziristan early Sunday, security officials said.The midnight attack took place in the Spinwam area of North Waziristan, where the military launched a major offensive against the Taliban and other insurgents in June.Officials said both military and paramilitary troops were inside the well-protected fort, locally known as FC Qila (FC Fort) at the time.

articles.title: Kogi Procures Nigeria's First Hyperbaric Oxygen Treatment Chamber
articles.excerpt: Nseobong Okon-Ekong The Kogi State Government has procured the first hospital based Hyperbaric Oxygen Treatment (HBOT) chamber in Nigeria. With this development, Nigeria becomes the fifth country i…
articles.summary:
Nseobong Okon-Ekong

The Kogi State Government has procured the first hospital based Hyperbaric Oxygen Treatment (HBOT) chamber in Nigeria.

With this development, Nigeria becomes the fifth country in Africa with such sophisticated medical equipment.

According to a statement yesterday, signed by the Commissioner for Health in Kogi State, Dr. Saka Haruna Audu, this was great news for Nigerian patients who hitherto had to travel abroad for such treatments.

K.d. lang has described her live shows as "the original Tinder".

articles.title: New entry rules come into force for passengers travelling from Azerbaijan to Russia
articles.excerpt: Starting from September 1 of this year, new entry rules will come into force for all flights operated from Azerbaijan to Russia. Thus, all passengers traveling on these flights must download 'Traveling without COVID-19' mobile application to their smartphones
articles.summary:
Baku, August 28, AZERTAC

Starting from September 1 of this year, new entry rules will come into force for all flights operated from Azerbaijan to Russia.

Thus, all passengers traveling on these flights must download 'Traveling without COVID-19' mobile application to their smartphones. Then a scan of their passport as well as the result of PCR test for COVID-19 should be uploaded to the app.

The application is free and can be downloaded:

- for iPhone: https://apps.apple.com/app/id1541206996

articles.author: Tnn
articles.excerpt: Continuing with the trend of no new Covid cases in Varanasi district since past few days, none among the 4,170 test reports received were confirmed as
articles.summary: VARANASI: Continuing with the trend of no new Covid cases in Varanasi district since past few days, none among the 4,170 test reports received were confirmed as positive for coronavirus infection on Friday too. No fatality due to coronavirus infection was reported in the last 24 hours.According to the daily medical bulletin, the tallies of positive cases and recoveries remained at 82,382 and 81,604, respectively in the district. Currently, there are five active cases of Covid-19 in Varanasi.So f

articles.title: 'Heartbreaking we can't bring everybody out'
articles.excerpt: The UK's evacuation of civilians from Afghanistan will end on Saturday.
articles.summary: Chief of the Defence Staff Gen Sir Nick Carter has said it was "heartbreaking" to not be able to bring everybody out of Afghanistan.The UK's evacuation of civilians from the country will end on Saturday. A mass airlift has been under way at Kabul airport since Taliban militants overran the capital this month.

articles.summary: Rivian is currently awaiting various governing agency approvals to begin U.S. deliveries of its R1T electric truck. (Rivian) Rivian is already behind its self-announced schedule for initial deliveries of its first electric vehicle (EV) models, the R1T pickup and the R1S SUV. That the COVID-19 pandemic pushed back the initial Fall 2020 delivery date is not a surprise. Still, the coronavirus is not the only thing that's delaying things further beyond the revised launch date, which Rivian had reset

articles.title: What is fiscal space and who wants it?
articles.excerpt: There are various definitions of ‘fiscal space', all broadly based on the idea of having some kind of financial reserve or money held &lsq...
articles.summary: There are various definitions of ‘fiscal space', all broadly based on the idea of having some kind of financial reserve or money held ‘in the back pocket' which would allow a government to deal with unexpected spending needs. Economist Peter Heller has defined it 'as room in a government's budget that allows it to provide resources for a desired purpose without jeopardising the sustainability of its financial position or the stability of the economy'. © Provided by Mid-Day 

Sandra Oh, who played Cristina Yang in the TV series `Grey`s Anatomy` from 2005 to 2014, described her role as "traumatic" as it earned her a whole new level of stardom. In a sneak peek from Oh`s interview on `Sunday Today with Willie Geist`, she said: "To be perfectly honest, it was traumatic. It was traumatic." articles.title: Israeli swimmer Ami Omer Dadaon wins silver at Tokyo Paralympic Games
articles.excerpt: Dadaon finishes second in the men's 150-meter individual medley, netting Israel its third medal in the games
articles.summary:
Paralympic swimmer Ami Omer Dadaon won Israel's third medal at the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games on Saturday, clinching second place and a silver medal in the men's 150-meter individual medley.

Dadaon finished the race in the SM4 category in 2 minutes and 29.48 seconds. Russia's Roman Zhdanov took the gold and Japan's Takayuki Suzuki took the bronze.

Dadaon, 20, has cerebral palsy. His mother Yafa told Channel 12 news: 'Everyone is happy and overjoyed. He is our pride. He believed in himself all

articles.author: Hansi Lo Wang
articles.excerpt: For about 1 in 10 people counted for last year's U.S. census, a single check box was not enough to report their racial identities. Their multifaceted
articles.summary: For about 1 in 10 people counted for last year's U.S. census, a single check box was not enough to report their racial identities. Their multifaceted responses to the race question for the 2020 head count helped produce the data released this month for redrawing voting maps, enforcing civil rights laws and guiding federal funds to local communities. Now, demographers and other researchers are trying to figure out what caused the number of people who identified with more than one racial group to

articles.title: Melbourne RMIT student buys luxury apartment at Sky Garden complex by working as cafe barista
articles.author: Miriah Davis
articles.excerpt: Adam Feng, 21, has barely finished his second year at RMIT University before he purchased his first apartment at Melbourne's luxury Sky Garden complex in Glen Waverley.
articles.summary:
A university student who worked as a barista in between classes for just $18 an hour was able to save a $50,000 house deposit in six months by investing in the stock market and getting a second job.

Adam Feng, 21, who is only in his second year at RMIT University, bought the luxury apartment from the Sky Garden complex in Melbourne's Glen Waverley back in May.

The student, who was tired of living at home with his parents, scored a $510,000 one-bedroom flat at the height of the Covid pandemic b

articles.summary: Work on one of NSW's largest hospital upgrades will begin within weeks as the government awards the building contract to developer Lendlease.Liverpool Hospital, in Sydney's south-west, will have 900 beds, an expanded emergency department, new maternity and paediatric inpatient beds after the upgrade.The new hospital, to be finished by 2026, will double its capacity both for care provided by the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit and for chemotherapy treatment in the Integrated Cancer Centre.Health Min

articles.title: Fallibility, part one
articles.excerpt: Psalm 119:89–96 Ever since I was knee-high to a gnat, I have been taught about and have believed in the infallibility of Scripture. Among the upper echelons of doctrinal truths, this one ranks…
articles.summary: Psalm 119:89–96 Ever since I was knee-high to a gnat, I have been taught about and have believed in the infallibility of Scripture. Among the upper echelons of doctrinal truths, this one ranks alongside the Godhead, the deity of Christ, and salvation by grace. We may fuss around with a few of the events in God's eschatological calendar or leave breathing room for differing opinions regarding angels and local church government. articles.title: After Taliban takeover, Qureshi visits Turkmenistan, tries to revive TAPI gas pipeline project
articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Aug 28: Buoyed by the Taliban takeover of Afghanistan, Pakistan has made a fresh bid to revive the Turkmenistan-Afghanistan-Pakistan-India (TAPI) gas pipeline project.
articles.summary:
During his visit to Ashgabat, Turkmenistan's capital, on Thursday, Pakistan's foreign minister Shah Mehmood Qureshi sought revival of the dormant project. Qureshi said that TAPI was beneficial for the entire region and Afghanistan alone would get $1 billion in transit fee and royalty after completion of the project, Paksitani daily Dawn reported.

Talking to the media following his meeting with Turkmen President Gurbanguly Berdimuhamedov, the foreign minister said the project was expected to cre

articles.title: Census shows slow, yet mixed, growth
articles.author: Gregory Maresca
articles.excerpt: The nation's founders recognized that a government of the people, by the people and for the people needed a consistent census. That is why every 10 years a census is
articles.summary: The nation's founders recognized that a government of the people, by the people and for the people needed a consistent census. That is why every 10 years a census is required by the Constitution.The custodian of the national Census are its numbers, but its progeny has always been — politics.The Census boils down to Congressional representation, which in turn, makes the political stakes and the scramble for federal monies paramount.The nation's overall population increased only 7% from 2010 — the

articles.title: To Compete With Beijing, the Quad Must Remain Pro-Asia, Not Anti-China
articles.excerpt: Countries across Southeast Asia do not wish to be pushed into choosing sides when their economic futures depend on maintaining positive ties with China and the United States.
articles.summary: AdvertisementThe Quadrilateral Security Dialogue, otherwise known as the Quad, has become a critical component in the United States' strategy in the Indo-Pacific since it was revived in 2017. While not a formal military alliance, its four members — Australia, India, Japan, and the United States — are powerful and influential democracies that, collectively, possess the ability to push back against China's growing regional assertiveness. However, at its core, Southeast Asia is a region where the f

articles.title: Second man charged in connection with murder of 32-year-old
articles.excerpt: Detectives investigating the death of a man in Leyton have charged a second man with murder.
articles.summary:
Victim Abdi Khadar Adan. Credit: Met Police Detectives investigating the death of a man in Leyton have charged a second man with murder.

 Abdi Khadar Adan died in hospital after he was stabbed in Lea Bridge Road at around 4.30pn on Sunday August 22.


 A post-examination held on August 24 confirmed the cause of death for the 32-year-old as a stab injury.

 Over the last few days, officers from the Metropolitan Police's specialist crime command have been investigating the incident.

articles.title: NBL's Dellavedova keeping NBA door open
articles.summary:
Melbourne United guard Matthew Dellavedova insists his NBA career is not over yet, saying he plans to use the upcoming National Basketball League (NBL) campaign to regain fitness and potentially return to the United States.

The 30-year-old returned home to Australia after signing a three-year deal with the NBL champions last month. He previously spent eight seasons in the NBA with the Cleveland Cavaliers and the Milwaukee Bucks.

Source: Xinhua| 2021-08-28 17:41:17|Editor: huaxia LAGOS, Aug. 28 (Xinhua) -- Nigerian police on Saturday confirmed that another batch of 32 students kidnapped by gunmen from a secondary school in the country's northwestern state of Kaduna has regained freedom.

articles.summary:
Josephine Skriver turns into a "different person" when she is cheering on her favorite NFL team.

The 28-year-old model gets so involved in her American football side Las Vegas Raiders' games she often loses her voice after she has attended a match.

She said: "It would have been hard to do an interview today if we had a game the day before, because I tend to lose my voice.

"I turn into a different person when a game is on."

articles.author: Helix Consulting Llc
articles.excerpt: The Canadian prime minister had been set to address supporters in Bolton, Ontario, but the event was called off over security concerns. Dozens...
articles.summary:
13:32 28/08/2021 , World

The Canadian prime minister had been set to address supporters in Bolton, Ontario, but the event was called off over security concerns. Dozens of protesters gathered at the rally and shouted obscenities before Mr Trudeau could speak. The Liberal prime minister is hoping to secure a majority in a snap general election he called earlier this month. But in recent days his canvassing efforts have been dogged by protests against Covid-19 vaccines and government restrictions.

articles.summary:
As the climate crisis escalates, the world is banking on carbon-free energy to achieve a future with zero greenhouse gas emissions, or a net-zero future, where we remove just as much greenhouse gas from the atmosphere as we emit.

One potential form of clean energy is green hydrogen, which is derived from renewable sources like water, rather than fossil fuels, and can be used to power heavy industry and fuel large vehicles, like planes and ships.

A handout picture released by the British Ministry of Defence on Aug. 24, 2021 and taken on Aug. 22, 2021 shows members of the UK Armed Forces during the operation to support the evacuation of British nationals and entitled personel at Kabul airport in Afghanistan.

Photo by AFP

articles.title: Mandalika Circuit to Host MotoGP Pre-Season Tests in February
articles.excerpt: Mandalika is also slated to host a World Superbike race in November, but it could be in doubt if constructions cannot be completed in time.
articles.summary: Workers complete the work to pave Mandalika Circuit racetrack in Lombok, West Nusa Tenggara, on August 14, 2021. (Photo courtesy of Mandalika Grand Prix Association) BY :THE JAKARTA GLOBE AUGUST 28, 2021 Jakarta. The yet-to-be-completed Mandalika Circuit in Indonesia's West Nusa Tenggara province will host MotoGP pre-session tests early next year, while its debut for World Superbike is also edging closer. articles.title: Non, merci: English-speaking Cameroon rises up, wants Republic of Ambazonia
articles.author: Mbom Sixtus
articles.excerpt: Long marginalised within a majority French-speaking country, Cameroon's Anglophone regions now want to secede
articles.summary:
A middle-aged man stands in front of a freshly covered grave, a flag tied around his neck. The flag has blue and white stripes and a white dove in its top left quadrant, but these are not the colours of any country recognised by the United Nations.
That is something this man and thousands like him in the two western English-speaking regions of Cameroon want to change. They are agitating for secession, and the creation of a brand-new country called the Republic of Ambazonia.

articles.title: PSB slams POA performance, wants PM to intervene
articles.author: The Newspaper'S Sports Reporter
articles.excerpt: Holds Pakistan Olympic Association responsible for mismanagement at Tokyo Olympics.
articles.summary:
ISLAMABAD: Criticising the Pakistan Olympic Association for the country's pathetic show in the recent-held Tokyo Olympics, the executive committee of the Pakistan Sports Board (PSB) on Friday urged Prime Minister Imran Khan to take up the matter in order to save Pakistan sports from further decline.

The meeting agreed that the name of Pakistan would be used only by those who followed the government's guidelines.

articles.title: Afghanistan to be free of explosions once US troops leave: T...
articles.author: MENAFN
articles.excerpt: Acting minister of culture and information and spokesperson of the Taliban Zabiullah Mujahid said, there remains no incentive for any blast or
articles.summary:
(MENAFN - Khaama Press)

Acting minister of culture and information and spokesperson of the Taliban Zabiullah Mujahid said, there remains no incentive for any blast or attack once foreign forces leave Afghanistan.

He said the twin explosions which inflicted casualties to over 250 people at Hamid Karzai International Airport, occurred in an area under US troops' control, not the Taliban's.

Zabiullah Mujahid in his interview with radio free of Afghanistan said that the presence of foreign forces

Etosha at Beginning vs. End of November Trip 
27 Aug. 2021, 11:39 pm

articles.title: Introduction
articles.excerpt: This month the Latin American Regional Report: Mexico covers issues in the areas of public security, social and fiscal policy, and labour rights faced...
articles.summary: This month the Latin American Regional Report: Mexico covers issues in the areas of public security, social and fiscal policy, and labour rights faced by the government led by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador. To be resolved, all these issues require major changes in policy and strategy.
